page.title: 02 INGESTRE VILLAGE
page.content: Ingestre is a small village which was first established around the year 1000 AD. and was owned by the Chetwynd family. Ingestre is situated about 5 miles from Stafford. The population consists of approximately 100 people and they live a few dwellings in the midst of a rural environment. Within this setting there is a considerable amount of evidence relaying the local history. For example, there are homes which date back to the last century and new homes which have recently been built, a feature of this is the conversion of an old stable into luxury flats. This image of old and new aspects is also reflected in the buildings such as the the church and hall which are set into the background of the golf club that occupies some of the land.
